info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:38PM EDT until June 22 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN STAFFORD...KING GEORGE AND EASTERN SPOTSYLVANIA COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF FREDERICKSBURG... At 237 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from King George to 8 miles northwest of Port Royal to near Massaponax, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated and observed wind. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Fredericksburg, King George, Fairview Beach, Potomac Creek, Massaponax, Spotsylvania, Falmouth, Passapatanzy, Stones Corner, Weedonville, Snell, Spring Valley, Thornburg, Lambs Creek, White Oak, Sealston, Jersey, Berthaville, Shiloh and Brookfield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
